text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a nice little party snack ripe
a brie with pear and black pepper and by
the way this wasn't even supposed to be
a recipe this was a camera test as i
tried to experiment with white balance I
usually use natural light but sometimes
when I'm forced to film using the
kitchen light everything looks orange
and yellow and ugly so that's how this
came to be and then I realized hey it's
not a bad little video recipe alright so
we're gonna take one wedge a very ripe
brie you see the white rind how it's
getting like a little kind of brown gray
and the inside is really soft in fact
this is right out of the fridge and it's
still that soft and you want some kind
of neutral cracker I would look for
something called water cracker in the
store they're very thin very light all
right you don't want like a garlic onion
or you know something that has a lot of
texture and flavor all right I'm gonna
take a piece of Brie you don't have to
cut off the rind by the way this is very
ripe in fact getting a little dark if I
was doing this for a party I probably
would use something slightly more
aesthetically pleasing but this was just
for Michelle and me so I'm gonna take my
cracker I'm gonna spread it with the
ripe Bree look at that looks pretty good
already and then we're gonna take a very
ripe pear and we're gonna cut it in thin
slices alright and then you probably
figured out the rest already we're gonna
place our pear on top of the Brie and
then to finish it off and I hope you're
sitting down we're gonna finish this
with freshly ground black pepper kind of
on the coarse grind I want to see it and
if you think that putting black pepper
on fruit is weird you're not alone it is
a little unusual but trust me it totally
works alright it's really really good
makes for a very very cool party bite
okay and we all know there's two types
of friends there are the low maintenance
beer and pretzel friends and then the
higher maintenance wine and cheese
friends also known as your friends and
your wife's friends so when those
fancier wine and cheese people are
coming over this is a really nice thing
to pull out and like I said this was
basically a test of some camera settings
and then when I finished I was like hey
that's good enough to put up who's gonna
complain about that
nice little appetizer so I hope you give
it a try I'm not even gonna list the
ingredients because it's brief pear and
crackers and black pepper all right but
go to food wishes calm for more
information and as always enjoy
